TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He is represented before ORG by the LOC law office from PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant , a mine worker of NORP citizenship who has lived on the territory of GPE since DATE , had a work - related accident while working for PERSON lignita PERSON , a mining enterprise .
On DATE ORG GPE granted the applicant the status of partial ( “ third - degree ” ) disability , including the right to a reduced workload .

In DATE , after GPE became an independent state , the applicant did not obtain NORP citizenship because , as he claims , he lived in a bachelor 's home and did not , therefore , satisfy the statutory condition of “ permanent residence ” . He thus became an alien and lodged a request to obtain a work permit , which was issued for the period of one year , expiring on DATE .

On DATE the PERSON lignita Velenje « enterprise terminated the applicant 's contract of employment on the ground that his work permit was about to expire . The termination was to take effect on DATE .

On DATE the applicant lodged an objection with the appellate authority of the enterprise , claiming that the enterprise could not dismiss him because he was a disabled worker with the right to a reduced workload . The objection was rejected on DATE .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings at ORG , arguing that the legislation on the protection of disabled workers should have precedence over the legislation governing the employment of aliens .

On DATE the ORG held a hearing and adopted a decision on DATE , rejecting the applicant 's claim on the ground that his employment contract had been terminated ex lege , as provided by LAW DATE in force at the material time . The ORG stated that the LAW did not provide for any exception for disabled persons , nor did it require an employer to obtain a work permit for disabled persons .
On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against the first - instance decision , but on DATE ORG rejected the appeal .

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law , which was rejected by ORG on DATE . ORG held that LAW DATE was adopted later ( lex posterior ) and governed a more specific subject - matter ( lex specialis ) than LAW DATE , which regulates the protection of disabled workers . The applicant 's employment had accordingly been lawfully terminated .

On DATE , the applicant lodged a constitutional appeal with ORG . The constitutional appeal was declared admissible on DATE but was rejected on the merits on DATE . ORG found that the interpretation of the legislation adopted by ORG did not infringe the applicant 's human rights and fundamental freedoms ( “ fourth - instance ” ) . CARDINAL judge wrote a dissenting opinion .

Further to CARDINAL separate requests in DATE , the applicant 's lawyer informed the ORG in DATE that the applicant and his CARDINAL children had acquired the NORP citizenship on DATE by virtue of a decision issued by ORG . It could also be understood from the lawyer 's submissions that the applicant had been working on a temporary basis for different companies , including for the Velenje mining enterprise since DATE .
Section CARDINAL
“ An employer may not enter into an employment relation or a work contract with an alien who does not have a work permit ...
A contract of employment or a work contract concluded with an alien who does not have a work permit is void . ”
Section CARDINAL

“ An alien 's employment relation with his employer is terminated if the work permit expires ... or if it is revoked ... , on DATE or on the date when the revocation decision becomes final respectively . ”
Section CARDINAL

“ A disabled worker has the right to be transferred to an appropriate post with due regard to his remaining capacity to work , the right to retraining or additional training , the right to be transferred to a post appropriate to his skills , and the right to appropriate wage compensation related to the exercise of these rights according to the legislation on retirement and disability insurance .

In all cases mentioned in the first ... paragraph of this section the organisation or the employer must provide the worker a post appropriate to his skills , under conditions and in the manner provided by an internal act or a collective agreement in accordance with the law . ”
